moves.3... Bg4: This is a weak move already.--Fischer
moves.7. Qb3: ! still attacking the f7 and also b7!
moves.8. Nc3: Morphy does not grab the pawn, but continues to develop.
moves.9. Bg5:
Black is in what's like a zugzwang position here.  He can't 
develop the [Queen's] knight because the pawn is hanging, 
the bishop is blocked because of the Queen.--Fischer
moves.9... b5: Perhaps black can drive white back with the pawns?
moves.10. Nxb5: Not Morphy!!! he sees all!!! Material is less than the attack!!
moves.13. Rxd7: Now an exchange sacrifice as well!!! Morphy sees that he can bring the other rook into the attack!!
moves.13... Rxd7 14. Rd1 Qe6: Black breaks the pin on the knight else the queen is dead meat!
moves.15... Nxd7 16. Qb8+: And then the finish!!! A queen sacrifice!!!! the knight must take!
moves.16... Nxb8 17. Rd8#:
Bam!!! the last two pieces in Morphy's camp give mate!!!

This is one of my favorite games, My heart quickens whenever I play vs a philidore that I may repeat this game.

gameName: Paul Morphy vs Duke Karl / Count Isouard Paris 1858
